title: Amazon’s big spring sale continues, and we found the 100 best deals

title: BougeRV’s telescopic lantern is ridiculously versatile
snippets: The BougeRV LED lantern, marketed as an outdoor light, functions as a versatile work lamp suitable for various settings needing additional illumination. It is rechargeable, portable, and features three adjustable LED panels that emit up to 3000 lumens, making it ideal for use in areas like campsites, workspaces, or for mechanical work.
summary: The BougeRV LED lantern is a rechargeable, portable outdoor light with three adjustable LED panels. It emits up to 3000 lumens, making it suitable for various settings such as campsites, workspaces, and mechanical work, where extra illumination is needed.

title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction preventing the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) pending the outcome of an ongoing court case.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction that stops the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) while a court case is ongoing.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft announced that in its latest Windows 11 Insider Preview, it will remove a bypass script previously allowing users to set up Windows 11 devices without an internet connection or logging into an account. This move enforces the requirement for all Windows 11 devices to be connected to the internet and logged in during setup.
summary: Microsoft has announced that its newest Windows 11 Insider Preview will eliminate a script that allowed users to set up the system without an internet connection or account login. This change mandates internet connection and account login for all Windows 11 device setups.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently ongoing until Monday, March 31st, offering a wide range of deals that are accessible without an Amazon Prime membership. The sale features over 100 deals on popular gear, alongside a selection of low-cost alternatives.
summary: Amazon is hosting its Big Spring Sale until March 31st, featuring over 100 deals on popular gear and various low-cost alternatives. These deals are available to all customers, not just Amazon Prime members.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has purchased the social media platform X (previously Twitter) in an all-stock deal. Musk valued xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, incorporating $12 billion of X's debt. This acquisition comes years after Musk originally bought Twitter for $44 billion.
summary: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, acquired the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. The deal values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, including $12 billion in debt. This purchase follows Musk's initial acquisition of Twitter for $44 billion years earlier.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This feature, announced last year, aims to enable IT professionals to remotely recover devices that won't boot, in response to incidents like the previous Crowdstrike catastrophe.
summary: Microsoft is testing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in the latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This tool is designed to help IT professionals remotely fix devices that fail to boot, addressing issues similar to those experienced during the Crowdstrike incident.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to a Google account until next year. This update follows Google's acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021 and their initial integration of Fitbit's services with Google's, which initially set a 2025 deadline for account migration.
summary: Google has postponed the deadline for Fitbit users to switch their accounts to Google accounts to next year, following its acquisition of Fitbit in 2021. This extension gives users more time beyond the initially set 2025 deadline for migrating their Fitbit services to Google's platform.

title: Researchers identify mutations that can lead to resistance to some chemotherapies
snippets: Investigators have discovered that mutations to VPS35, a crucial component in a pathway that uses reactive oxygen species (ROS) to eliminate cancer cells, can lead to chemotherapy resistance. This finding may assist in identifying tumors that are resistant to treatment.
summary: Investigators have found that mutations in VPS35, a key element in a pathway that employs reactive oxygen species (ROS) to destroy cancer cells, can cause resistance to chemotherapy. This discovery could help identify tumors that are resistant to treatment.

title: Discrimination-related depression, anxiety pronounced among multiracial, White, Asian populations
snippets: A study revealed that over 50% of US adults have faced discrimination, significantly impacting mental health. Those highly exposed to discrimination are over five times more likely to show signs of depression and anxiety. Moreover, individuals experiencing such mistreatment have almost nine times the likelihood of screening positive for both mental health conditions compared to those who haven't faced discrimination.
summary: A study found that over half of US adults have experienced discrimination, which greatly affects their mental health. Individuals who face high levels of discrimination are more than five times as likely to exhibit depression and anxiety symptoms. Furthermore, those subjected to mistreatment are nearly nine times more likely to test positive for both mental health issues than those who haven't experienced discrimination.

summary: A new 3D printed hydrogel, designed to be customizable, has demonstrated promising outcomes in preclinical trials for the treatment of different kinds of meniscal tears.

title: Cold plunges actually change your cells
snippets: A seven-day cold water immersion study shows it significantly boosts cellular resilience and autophagic function, aiding in stress management at a cellular level. This adaptation may contribute to improved health, disease prevention, and slower aging.
summary: A seven-day study on cold water immersion found it enhances cellular resilience and autophagic function, which helps cells manage stress better. This adaptation could lead to better health, disease prevention, and slower aging.

title: Researchers develop new DNA test for personalized treatment of bacterial vaginosis
snippets: Around one-third of women aged 14-49 in the U.S. experience bacterial vaginosis (BV), marked by odors and discomfort. Over half of those treated with the first-line antibiotic, metronidazole, face recurrence. Researchers have now created a DNA PCR-based lab test for a more accurate diagnosis, allowing for tailored treatments.
summary: In the U.S., about one-third of women aged 14-49 suffer from bacterial vaginosis, characterized by odors and discomfort. Over 50% of those treated with metronidazole, the primary antibiotic, experience a recurrence. Researchers have developed a DNA PCR-based lab test for more precise diagnosis, enabling personalized treatments.

title: Why scientists are worried about weasels
snippets: A study focused on improving camera trap effectiveness for monitoring weasels found that using red meat as bait, enhanced with scent oils, significantly increases the chances of capturing these elusive animals on camera. This method aims to aid conservationists in accurately tracking weasel populations.
summary: A study has found that using red meat bait, along with scent oils, significantly improves the success of camera traps in monitoring elusive weasels. This technique is aimed at helping conservationists track weasel populations more accurately.

title: Artificial neurons organize themselves
snippets: Researchers have developed novel artificial neurons that can learn independently, closely mimicking biological neurons. These "infomorphic neurons" form artificial neural networks that self-organize and learn from their immediate environment, enhancing their capacity to process information like their natural counterparts.
summary: Researchers have created "infomorphic neurons," a new type of artificial neuron that can independently learn and self-organize within artificial neural networks, closely resembling the learning process of biological neurons. This advancement allows these networks to better process information by learning from their surroundings.
